title: Wanted to Buy - Swage Pressing = having Pressed

posts.content:
My swage pressing on the long side window pressing is very badly corroded.
The lower panel has been removed and the swage has been shot blasted leaving bad pitting and lots of holes.

How have others repaired this?
Anyone grafted in new metal?

Is a repair pressing available or is it a case of searching for this section?

Has anyone cut up a body for the roof pressing and has any of this section left over that is available in usable condition...

Mine ...photo of bottom of swage looking through the hole where the long side panel was..





67USA? Saw you were cutting up a body but look to have used the LHD window panel...

Any pieces at all would be welcome to attempt to cut to let in and replace my moth eaten swage!

Is that the lower window section? If it's just holed thu get a repair panel made from the cut out section at a local sheetmetal/fab shop...? I wouldn't cut up a bus for that small area, also, if there is no rot left in those pitted areas, you could lead load it or filler it, not ideal, but that's assuming the rot has gone?

Yes ....lead loading is an alternative...
Has been shotblasted...and then protected with acid etch..
I have had metal sections made to sample before..For the Westfalia trailer by Karl at Autocraft...
Was trying to find a cut maybe..
David has worked on the rear corner and removed most of the dent/ crease and welded up the puller holes a treat.
The problem is the return to weld to the long panel is like a doily and thin..
Agree not expecting an easy find...
But if you do not ask....
Cheers G

If its the swage line (below the windows) then i had a big solid section for sale for a long time and let it go for very cheap in the end, after it getting in my way for 2 years.

If its a section above the windows then i have some cuts available.

It is the long section between the windows and the bottom of the upper window panel...

The bit that curves around and is welded to the long lower panel.

So that is the bit shown above the big gap on my picture..
Perhaps look for an old tailgate? Same pressing.

Dave says....(Having cut out and let in sections on many) that.. cargo door and rear hatch swage sections do not work..
Because of the window return and the lower return...do not work..
Can be from short side or long side
Either..Full length or short sections wanted to be donor sections..
Anyone?
G

Donor sections to cut and let in...
I am not looking for much !!!!!!

Had another very close look...
Will need the whole length...
There are holes all the way along from front to back.
So back to the option of finding a long cut.
So Anyone?
Call Alan Scofield, I'm sure he can make it, he's got good machine. Or try autocraft, they use to make it, I bought mine from them, but that was few years back. Hope it helps

I have tried fbi and Graham Clarke as always has come back to me prompt but sadly he has none at the moment.
So will discuss with Karl Babington at Autocraft. He is local to Dave Haywood... Dave has restored items for Karl...

He did help greatly and make bespoke pieces for my Westfalia Trailer.


So the hunt goes on!

G
Karl is making me a section....I HOPE!!!!!
